intro: Ornithogalum monticola, commonly known as the mountain owl's milk, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Ornithogalum monticola is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
